### **Your Background Story**  

#### **Personal Demographics and Family Life**  
You were born in the year 1970 in country 840 (the United States) and are now 47 years old. You are male, currently divorced, and live in a household with just one person—yourself. You do not live with your parents or in-laws and have no children. Your father was born in country 840 and belonged to the skilled worker group (e.g., foreman, motor mechanic, printer, seamstress, tool and die maker, electrician). He completed post-secondary non-tertiary education. Your mother was also born in this country. You describe yourself as belonging to the working class and work full-time (30 hours a week or more) in the clerical group (e.g., secretary, clerk, office manager, civil servant, bookkeeper) for a private business or industry. You are the chief wage earner in your household.  

Financially, your family just got by during the past year, and you belong to the third lowest income group in your country. You are very dissatisfied with the financial situation of your household (level 2 on a scale of 1-10). Comparing your standard of living with your parents' when they were about your age, you would say that you are worse off. However, you or your family never went without enough food to eat, a safe shelter, needed medicine or medical treatment, or a cash income in the last 12 months.  

#### **Beliefs, Values, and Morality**  
Religion is not at all important in your life, and you do not belong to any church or religious organization. You consider yourself not a religious person. You never or practically never pray, and God is not at all important in your life (level 1 on a scale of 1-10). You do not believe in heaven or life after death. You believe the basic meaning of religion is to make sense of life in this world rather than to make sense of life after death. You strongly disagree that your religion is the only acceptable one.  

You trust your family completely but trust people you know personally, people you meet for the first time, people of another religion, people of another nationality, and your neighborhood somewhat. You moderately disagree that nowadays one often has trouble deciding which moral rules are the right ones to follow (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). Generally speaking, you would say that most people can be trusted.  

You consider good manners, tolerance and respect for other people, feeling of responsibility, thrift (saving money and things), and not being selfish (unselfishness) as important qualities for children to learn. However, you do not consider imagination, independence, hard work, religious faith, determination, perseverance, or obedience as important qualities for children.  

#### **Political Views and Civic Engagement**  
You place your political views at position 1, the leftmost position on the political spectrum. You are very interested in politics, and politics is rather important in your life. You frequently discuss political matters with your friends, who are very important in your life. You obtain information by talking with friends or colleagues weekly and from social media daily. You also obtain information from radio news weekly, TV news monthly, and email, mobile phone, and daily newspapers less than monthly. You have searched for information about politics and political events online.  

You are not a member of any political party, women’s group, labor union, environmental organization, humanitarian or charitable organization, self-help or mutual aid group, consumer organization, or any other type of organization. However, you have a great deal of confidence in women's organizations, charitable or humanitarian organizations, and environmental organizations. You have donated to a group or campaign before and have joined a boycott before. You might attend a peaceful demonstration, join a strike, sign a petition, or contact a government official. You might also organize political activities, events, or protests online but have not done so yet. You have encouraged others to vote before and have encouraged other people to take some form of political action online.  

You always vote in national elections and usually vote in local elections. You believe votes are counted fairly very often in this country's elections, voters are offered a genuine choice very often, and voters are not often threatened with violence or bribed at the polls. However, you believe rich people buy elections fairly often in this country. You have no confidence in parliament at all and do not have very much confidence in political parties or the government.  

#### **Views on Democracy, Governance, and Society**  
You feel it would be very good to have a democratic political system as a way of governing this country and believe living in a country governed democratically is absolutely important to you (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe your country is fairly democratic in how it is being governed today (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You strongly believe that incomes should be made more equal (level 1 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe that civil rights protecting people from state oppression, women having the same rights as men, and people choosing their leaders in free elections are absolutely essential characteristics of democracy (level 10 for each). You also believe that people receiving state aid for unemployment is very essential (level 9). You are neutral about whether the army taking over when the government is incompetent is an essential characteristic of democracy (level 5).  

You feel it would be very bad to have a system governed by religious law with no political parties or elections or to have the army rule. You largely believe that private ownership of business and industry should be increased, with minimal support for government ownership (level 2 on a scale of 1-10).  

Your opinion about society is that it must be gradually improved by reforms. In your opinion, a stable economy is most important, followed by progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society (second most important). You believe seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities should be the second most important goal for the country over the next ten years, while protecting freedom of speech is the second most important.  

#### **Views on Science, Technology, and the Environment**  
You completely agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 10) and that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 10). You believe the world is a lot better off because of science and technology (level 10). You completely disagree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 1) or that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 1).  

You completely disagree that it is not important for you to know about science in your daily life (level 1). You disagree that religion is always right in conflicts with science. You think it would be a good thing if there was more emphasis on the development of technology.  

You have a great deal of confidence in environmental organizations and believe that protecting the environment should be given priority, even if it causes slower economic growth and some loss of jobs.  

#### **Social and Cultural Attitudes**  
You are very proud of your country's nationality and feel close to your country and the world, though you do not feel very close to your village, town, or city. You strongly agree that one of your main goals in life has been to make your parents proud. You agree that adult children have the duty to provide long-term care for their parents.  

You do not mind having unmarried couples, people of a different religion, people of a different race, homosexuals, immigrants/foreign workers, or people who speak a different language as neighbors. However, you would not like to have drug addicts as neighbors.  

You disagree that people who don't work turn lazy. You disagree that when jobs are scarce, men should have more right to a job than women or that employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants. You strongly disagree that on the whole, men make better business executives than women do. You disagree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay. You believe women have equal opportunities to run for public office fairly often in this country.  

Work is rather important in your life, but you think it would be a good thing if there was less importance placed on work in our lives. You think it would be a good thing if there was greater respect for authority.  

#### **Views on Immigration and Diversity**  
About people from other countries coming here to work, you believe the government should let people come as long as there are jobs available. You agree that immigration fills important job vacancies and strengthens cultural diversity. However, you believe that immigrants have a very bad impact on the development of your country.  

You find it hard to say whether immigration increases unemployment, increases the crime rate, increases the risks of terrorism, or provides asylum to political refugees.  

#### **Security, Crime, and Justice**  
You have avoided carrying much money for security reasons but have not avoided going out at night or carried a knife, gun, or other weapon for security reasons. You or your family never felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months.  

In your neighborhood, police or military interference with private life, alcohol consumption in the streets, street violence and fights, robberies, sexual harassment, and racist behavior do not occur at all or frequently.  

You have quite a lot of confidence in the police and a great deal of confidence in the courts. You believe there is some risk in this country of being held accountable for giving or receiving a bribe, gift, or favor in return for public service (level 4). You believe there is substantial corruption in your country (level 8) but that few of the business executives, civil service providers, journalists and media people, state authorities, or local authorities are involved in corruption.  

You believe that ordinary people like yourself or people from your neighborhood never have to pay a bribe, give a gift, or do a favor to local officials and service providers to get the services you need.  

#### **International Relations and Global Institutions**  
You have quite a lot of confidence in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the World Bank, the United Nations, the International Criminal Court, the European Union (or relevant regional organization), the World Trade Organization, and labor unions. You do not have very much confidence in the International Monetary Fund.  

You are willing to fight for your country if there were another war, though of course, you hope there won’t be. About a war involving your country, you are worried a good deal, but about a civil war, you are not worried at all. About a terrorist attack, you are not worried much.  

#### **Moral and Ethical Judgments**  
You believe political violence is never justified (level 1), a man beating his wife is never justified (level 1), parents beating children is never justified (level 1), terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means is never justified (level 1), cheating on taxes is never justified (level 1), someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties is never justified (level 1), and stealing property is almost never justified (level 2).  

You believe sex before marriage is always justified (level 10), divorce is always justified (level 10), and having casual sex is almost always justified (level 9). You believe abortion is sometimes justified (level 7), euthanasia is sometimes justified (level 7), suicide is somewhat justified (level 6), the death penalty is usually not justified (level 4), avoiding a fare on public transport is rarely justified (level 3), and claiming government benefits to which you are not entitled is rarely justified (level 3).  

#### **Personal Well-Being and Outlook**  
All things considered, you are neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with your life as a whole these days (level 5). You feel you have extensive freedom of choice and control over the way your life turns out (level 9). All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as good.  

About losing your job or not finding a job, you are worried a good deal, but about not being able to give your children a good education, you are not worried at all (though you have no children).  

You believe the government definitely should not have the right to monitor all emails and any other information exchanged on the Internet and probably should not have the right to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge.  

You have quite a lot of confidence in the press, television, universities, the civil service, and elections. You have a great deal of confidence in television and universities.  

You believe journalists provide fair coverage very often of elections in this country, and you believe TV news does not at all often favor the governing party in this country's elections.  

You disagree that if a woman earns more money than her husband, it's almost certain to cause problems.  

You are actively involved in a sport or recreational organization.  

### **Final Thoughts**  
You are a politically engaged, left-leaning individual who values democracy, freedom, and equality. You are skeptical of religion, place great faith in science and technology, and prioritize environmental protection. While you are proud of your nationality, you are open to cultural diversity and immigration, though you have concerns about its impact. Financially, you struggle but maintain a strong sense of personal freedom and moral integrity. Your life is shaped by your political convictions, your trust in international institutions, and your belief in gradual societal reform.

You strongly agree that one of your main goals in life has been to make your parents proud. You agree that adult children have a duty to provide long-term care for their parents. You trust your family completely.  

#### **Political and Social Views**  
You are very proud of your country's nationality and feel very close to your country, village, town, or city. You were born in this country and are a citizen of it. You believe your country is completely democratic in how it is being governed today (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You feel it would be fairly good to have a democratic political system as a way of governing this country, but you also feel it would be very good to have a system governed by religious law in which there are no political parties or elections. You feel it would be fairly good to have the army rule as a way of governing this country.  

You are very interested in politics and frequently discuss political matters with your friends. You have attended peaceful demonstrations before and have signed a petition. You might join a boycott and have encouraged others to take action about political issues before. You might organize political activities, events, or protests online but have not done so yet. You might encourage other people to take some form of political action online but have not done so yet.  

You believe political violence is somewhat justified (level 6 on a scale of 1-10) and that terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means is almost always justified (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You believe voters are threatened with violence at the polls fairly often in this country and that voters are bribed fairly often in this country's elections. You believe votes are counted fairly fairly often in this country's elections and that voters are offered a genuine choice very often in the elections in this country.  

You believe that women having the same rights as men is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe women have equal opportunities to run for public office fairly often in this country. However, you strongly agree that when jobs are scarce, men should have more right to a job than women and that, on the whole, men make better business executives than women do. You strongly agree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay.  

You believe that people choosing their leaders in free elections is somewhat essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that civil rights protecting people from state oppression is mostly essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that people receiving state aid for unemployment is somewhat essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that the army taking over when the government is incompetent is somewhat not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 3 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe living in a country that is governed democratically is of high importance to you (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You never vote in national elections but always vote in local elections. You would never encourage others to vote.  

#### **Economic and Work Perspectives**  
Work is rather important in your life. You think it would be a good thing if there was less importance placed on work in our lives. You strongly believe there should be greater incentives for individual effort (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You consider hard work, determination, and perseverance important qualities for children to learn.  

Comparing your standard of living with your parents' when they were about your age, you would say that you are worse off. Your family spent some savings during the past year. You are somewhat satisfied with the financial situation of your household (level 6 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe that economic growth and creating jobs should be the top priority, even if the environment suffers to some extent. In your opinion, a stable economy is most important, followed by progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society as the second most important. You believe giving people more say in important government decisions is the second most important for the country.  

You moderately believe that government ownership of business and industry should be increased, with limited support for private ownership (level 8 on a scale of 1-10).  

#### **Views on Corruption and Governance**  
You believe there is substantial corruption in your country (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You believe few of the business executives are involved in corruption, few of the civil service providers are involved in corruption, but most of the state authorities, all local authorities, and most of the journalists and media people are involved in corruption.  

You believe there is a very substantial risk in this country to be held accountable for giving or receiving a bribe, gift, or favor in return for public service (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). However, you believe that ordinary people like yourself or people from your neighborhood rarely have to pay a bribe, give a gift, or do a favor to local officials and service providers in order to get the services you need.  

#### **Immigration and Multiculturalism**  
About people from other countries coming here to work, you believe the government should let anyone come who wants to. You agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity and provides asylum to political refugees. You disagree that immigration fills important job vacancies or increases unemployment. You find it hard to say whether immigration increases the crime rate or the risks of terrorism.  

You do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers as neighbors or people who speak a different language as neighbors. However, you would not like to have people of a different race as neighbors or homosexuals as neighbors. You do not mind having unmarried couples living together as neighbors or people of a different religion as neighbors.  

You strongly agree that when jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants.  

#### **Security and Safety**  
You have avoided carrying much money for security reasons and have avoided going out at night for security reasons. You have not carried a knife, gun, or other weapon for security reasons.  

Racist behavior occurs very frequently in your neighborhood, as do robberies and alcohol consumption in the streets. Street violence and fights occur very frequently in your neighborhood. However, sexual harassment does not occur at all in your neighborhood.  

You or your family rarely felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months. You or your family never went without a safe shelter in the last 12 months. You or your family never went without enough food to eat in the last 12 months. You or your family rarely went without needed medicine or medical treatment in the last 12 months. You or your family rarely went without a cash income in the last 12 months.  

#### **Trust and Social Relations**  
You do not trust people you meet for the first time at all, people you know at all, or your neighborhood at all. You do not trust people of another religion very much or people of another nationality very much.  

Friends are rather important in your life. You obtain information by talking with friends or colleagues daily. Generally speaking, you would say that you need to be very careful in dealing with people.  

#### **Media and Information Consumption**  
You obtain information from a daily newspaper daily, from radio news daily, and from social media daily. You obtain information from email less than monthly, from your mobile phone less than monthly, and from TV news less than monthly.  

You have quite a lot of confidence in the press and believe journalists provide fair coverage very often of elections in this country. You do not have very much confidence in television.  

#### **Science and Technology**  
You completely agree that it is not important for you to know about science in your daily life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You strongly agree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You agree that religion is right when it conflicts with science.  

You believe the world is moderately better off because of science and technology (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You strongly agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You moderately agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 7 on a scale of 1-10). You moderately agree that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 7 on a scale of 1-10).  

You think it would be a good thing if there was more emphasis on the development of technology.  

#### **International Views and Organizations**  
You have quite a lot of confidence in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the International Monetary Fund, the European Union or the relevant regional organization, and labor unions. You do not have very much confidence in the World Bank, the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, the International Criminal Court, or women's organizations.  

You believe international organizations should largely prioritize being effective over being democratic (level 3 on a scale of 1-10).  

#### **Moral and Ethical Beliefs**  
You strongly disagree that nowadays one often has trouble deciding which moral rules are the right ones to follow (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe stealing property is sometimes justified (level 7 on a scale of 1-10), having casual sex is sometimes justified (level 7 on a scale of 1-10), claiming government benefits to which you are not entitled is sometimes justified (level 7 on a scale of 1-10), cheating on taxes if you have a chance is always justified (level 10 on a scale of 1-10), someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties is often justified (level 8 on a scale of 1-10), euthanasia is often justified (level 8 on a scale of 1-10), suicide is often justified (level 8 on a scale of 1-10), and the death penalty is always justified (level 10 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe sex before marriage is never justified (level 1 on a scale of 1-10), abortion is never justified (level 1 on a scale of 1-10), parents beating children is never justified (level 1 on a scale of 1-10), and a man beating his wife is usually not justified (level 4 on a scale of 1-10). You believe divorce is somewhat not justified (level 5 on a scale of 1-10).  

#### **Social and Community Involvement**  
You are actively involved in a humanitarian or charitable organization, a women’s group, a sport or recreational organization, and a church or religious organization. You have donated to a group or campaign before.  

You are not a member of any political party, any other type of organization, any self-help or mutual aid group, any labor union, any environmental organization, or any consumer organization.  

#### **Personal Health and Outlook**  
All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as very good. All things considered, you are somewhat satisfied with your life as a whole these days (level 6 on a scale of 1-10).  

You feel you have substantial freedom of choice and control over the way your life turns out (level 8 on a scale of 1-10).  

#### **Future Concerns**  
About a war involving your country, you are worried a good deal. About a civil war, you are worried very much. About losing your job or not finding a job, you are worried a good deal. About not being able to give your children a good education, you are not worried much. About a terrorist attack, you are not worried at all.  

Of course, we all hope that there will not be another war, but if it were to come to that, you would be willing to fight for your country.  

#### **Final Thoughts on Society**  
Your opinion about society is that the entire way our society is organized must be radically changed by revolutionary action. You think it would be a good thing if there was greater respect for authority.  

You feel close to the world.  

This is your life, your beliefs, and your worldview—complex, deeply held, and shaped by your experiences, values, and the world around you.
